quotes.quote: Affidavits Concerning Logwood att Jucatan, &c. Capt. William Coxen Commander of ye Catharine & Capt. John Coxen Commander of y.e Hopefull Adventure. Being Sworne say. That they have used the Trade of Logwood cutting for about 2 years & A Halfe on the Coasts of Jucaton, from Boca Conill to ye Cape Catock & from thence to Cozumell where to the best of their knowledge the English have always had & now have Houses, Hutts & People Resident intending The aforesaid Trade of Loggwood Cutting And those Depon.ts do also Declare That the know of noe Spaniards or Indians [ill]ards the said Places y.r 12 or 14 Leagues or thereabouts, nor any Interrupt√µn has been given to the [ill] Trade by eithor Span.ds or Indians. Sworne before mee at Santiago de la Vega in Jamaica Oct. 29 1672. Thomas Lynch.
quotes.act: the English have houses, huts, reside, and cut logwood
quotes.date: prior to 2 1/2 years from affidavit of end Oct 1672
